website_summaries.verdict: If you need an industrial-sized cord for outdoor use, you can't go wrong with this extension cord.
pros: Molded ends are a nice safety feature
cons: The cord is fairly stiff, especially in the beginning

customer_reviews.title: Works for 30 amp 240 V electric vehicle chargers too!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30 amp 240V electric car charger that I have in my garage for my VW eGolf that wasn't the mounted in the most ideal place so I wanted to move it without having to hire an electrician to move my outlet. Instead, I purchased this extension and moved the charger to another part of the garage and it works great. The cable was just long enough to reach where I wanted the charger mounted. Very pleased with it. Most reviews here are for a welder but it works great for electric vehicle chargers.
customer_reviews.author: PabloParque

customer_reviews.title: Not Southwire Brand....  Scam!!
customer_reviews.text: When order it says Southwire, but this is made in china for coleman cable inc . The listing has southwire name and photos of southwire, but when received was knock-off Chinese Cable...
customer_reviews.author: Gaston H Moore

customer_reviews.title: “No Weak Link Here”
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for use with my Lincoln 210 MP as my shop is about 40’ deep and the factory cord is all of about 4’ - 5’ long ... Used with welder cranked almost all the way up welding near the limits of the welder, “0” issues and this cord is HEAVY DUTY! Would definitely recommend and buy again if necessary but I don’t see that happening unless I shear it off with my post lift somehow!
customer_reviews.author: CTA

customer_reviews.title: Runs a Millermatic 211 and Hypertherm Powermax65 just fine. My only complaint is that the receptacle end ...
customer_reviews.text: For the time being, I'm using two of these end-to-end to get 220v power into my new shop. Runs a Millermatic 211 and Hypertherm Powermax65 just fine. My only complaint is that the receptacle end is exceptionally tight, so swapping between the two machines is a bit of a pain. It takes some grunting to unplug one machine, and I don't quite feel comfortable with that and having 220v right in my (gloved) hands. Hopefully I'll have a subpanel installed in the next month or so, then these cables will let me move both tools around the shop with ease.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Not a Southwire Product!
customer_reviews.text: More bait and switch on a technicality; this cord is actually made by Coleman Cable in China which has been acquired or purchased by Southwire. So although technically owned by Southwire, this is NOT a Southwire product as described... Now with that out of the way, I am pleased with the quality and performance of the product. It is of good construction and is heavy duty. Having 25 feet plus the length of the machines cord I am able to go anywhere in the garage and driveway with my machines.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Professional look.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cable. I cut the cable into 2 pieces. The longer piece is wired into a junction box at my service and coiled on the wall as an extension cord. Its ready for any of my machines when I need it. The shorter end is wired into the connections on my machine. I get the security of a molded plug and receptacle with a clean and professional look. Be aware that the cover sheet on the cable indicates 40 amp service while the Amazon description indicates 50 amps. The​ blue color is a good match for Miller welders.
customer_reviews.author: P. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great cord, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this in my garage for my Hobart Handler 190 Mig welder. It works great, It reaches all parts of my garage and I'm happy with the price of this cord. I roll everything up on my welding cart when finished and store away. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim Kryshtal

customer_reviews.title: best extension cord I've ever owned for my welder for the best price
customer_reviews.text: love it had it for months now and u can't be the quality you get at this price. extra heavy duty, plastic mold around the plugs are great to help keep them protected with out having to baby it around your fab shop. you can drop with no worries highly recommend the product.. its still even cheaper then you building your own extension cord for your welder. but just so the u know it has some weight behind it ..
customer_reviews.author: Milton E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a welder!
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord is phenomenal! The ends are the extremely durable and the jacket on the cord is of high quality as well. I run a 220v welder with this cord and have no issues. The lighted ends are nice as well. I will be purchasing another for my compressor! I must add that the cord I received is was not branded as “Southwire.” I cant remember the exact branding but it is in fact of excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny 5

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Knock-Off, NOT SOUTHWIRE/COLEMAN.
customer_reviews.text: Not a SouthWire/Coleman product as advertised, this is a Chinese knock-off. I have no idea how it will hold up, and have only used it to power up the welder thus far. While I’m sure it will function, I do not appreciate Amazon permitting a vendors false advertisement. I now also see other reviews stating similarly, that they bought a “southwire” cord, and received a Chinese knock-off which means this has been an ongoing issue. Get your house in order Amazon, we’re losing faith in your platform. Verify your independent sellers, or do not allow them on your platform. Simple. Sloggett
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: So soft, you want to snuggle it!
customer_reviews.text: To say this cord is flexible is the understatement of the year, this cord is as soft and flexible like warm honey, and feels that sweet also, I have not tasted it. It carries power to my welder in the best way, almost like velvet gloves, my welder is so happy with this cord, I think it is jealous that it's cord is not as soft. Jealousy will get you nowhere. The lighted end makes a warm glow, and really sets the ambiance for hooking up the welder. I would recommend this to a friend, it is a good cord.
customer_reviews.author: Radar Mile

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well priced
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord was extremely handy in my shop. With so much of the larger industrial equipment running off 240, its very handy to have an extension cord lying around so that your equipment isn't constrained to being 3ft from the wall at all times. Just this weekend I put two together to form a 50ft extension, and was able to weld a bracket on the side of my house using my MIG. Very useful just to have on hand, whenever you may need it.
customer_reviews.author: John Duffet

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty extension cord. Using it on a 30 amp breaker circuit. It will never overload. Good quality cable. Very supple. The connector ends are heavy molded, looks like, rubber. Pretty sure they will never crack or break. And it has a light for checking power to the circuit at a glance. You cannot buy the individual pieces and make one better or cheaper. I was going to try. Then I found this. Glad I looked
customer_reviews.author: charles lozano

customer_reviews.title: Plugs are not perfect but do work
customer_reviews.text: The female plug is TIGHT to get anything plugged in. I had to lightly sand/massage the ground tang on my welder’s plug to get it to plug in. The welder plugs into the wall socket no problem as does the male end of this cord. Not sure why the female end doesn’t match like it should. Once plugged in, it worked fine on a 250A welder.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Heneghan

customer_reviews.title: Crazy thick compared to my welders cord.
customer_reviews.text: This has an LED on the female end that is very dim. It may assist in finding the end of the cord in a dark situation but otherwise, it's kinda pointless. The sheer size of this cable was impressive upon opening the box it looks very industrial. I don't know the Actual size of the wiring inside only what the ad states but I am very satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: DIY or Die

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well built and definitely 8/3 gauge with a strong jacket. The male plug is well built for many insertions/withdrawals over the years. The female plug is also well built and lights up. If you don't have an extension cord for your welder, your limiting your workspace.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbalicious

customer_reviews.title: Great Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: I bought a like new one from Amazon warehouse .. this is heavy duty. Works great to connect my welder to my dryer plug adjacent to the garage. I have this connected to the 30A dryer adapter & it works great with my titanium 200 welder.
customer_reviews.author: Mack2

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Cord
customer_reviews.text: This was cheaper than making an extension cord myself and much nicer. My entire life prior to finding this I thought if someone needed an extension cord like this it had to be cobbled together with parts from the hardware store. The molded an illuminated end make this a very nice product. I was so happy with it the first time I used it I ordered a second one. After that I showed it to a friend who immediately bought one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: As a hobbyist, I ask a lot of questions and was told some negative things on extension cords. So, I was limited to welding in a small space. I had it, and started to read reviews and try to extend my length. I ended up on this one based solely on reviews and I have to say I’m very pleased with this cord. No power shortage, no overheating, and the cord is super heavy duty and the length was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Webb

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Southwire brand 240 v 50, 25' extension cord. I received a product from Coleman Cable that states clearly on it "Made in China." At first I thought I had been a victim of a bait and switch ad, however, I did a little research and discovered that Southwire purchased Coleman Cable in 2013. Up until now I had no idea that Southwire sold any chinese manufactured goods.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A Allen

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty!
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord for welders is the real deal. It's really very heavy duty, great built quality and priced very well for how much cable you get. The lights in the plugs are helpful, as they let you know if your cord is live. I use it with my Miller 211 welder, which is a good match: blue extension cord + blue welder :)
customer_reviews.author: 21days

customer_reviews.title: Great to extend EVSE Electric “Car Charger”
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2014 as a spare extension cord for our electric cars. It’s Rated for 40 amps continuous which is inline with a NEMA 6-50 outlet. We needed to temporarily relocate our EVSE and this did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Survi

customer_reviews.title: Great cord!
customer_reviews.text: It turns out the only issue I have with this cord was one of the reasons I bought it. The outlet I plug it into is outside and has an "in-use" cover to protect it from the elements. There is no way a straight plug end would have been able to let the cover close, but with the angle it hit the bottom half of the cover and I needed to clearance it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cote

customer_reviews.title: Great cord for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a new mug welder for Xmass and needed more than the 10' cord that the welder comes with. This cord appears very well made and should last a long time. I know I needed 10 gage for the 30 Amp rating on the welder, but I purchased this 8 gage cord just to be safe. And this was nearly the cheapest I could find a 25' cord.
customer_reviews.author: dachshundlady

customer_reviews.title: My old USA made welder is happy
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lincoln 110 stick welder (245 amps) I bought 55 yrs ago $100. I have it on a dolly, I now can move it out the door much further. Even with my long leads it makes it extra handy, much cheaper than leads or having to wire an outside Outlet .
customer_reviews.author: Over-Spender

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty cable.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely heavy duty cable. This is no small cable!!! It’s about as big around in diameter as a quarter! Works great for high voltage (240) carries the load as advertised. Reasonably priced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Wisenbaker

customer_reviews.title: Need more wire
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I give it 4 start because I was waiting at my job till 8pm on Monday-Thursday because FedEx sat it be delivered on Monday and say no one answered the door.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Middwest

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck here
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly and this thing is massive for the price. Ive got a 200 amp tig welder and it reaches the entire garage with no issues. It also powers my 60 amp plasma cutter with 0 problems. Best bang for the buck here
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hays

customer_reviews.title: 25' Welding cable
customer_reviews.text: A good welding cable, not so large that it is a burden I use it with my EverLast 161 STH and the cable supplies me with enough juice for all of my needs and the length for the freedom of movement I need.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality
customer_reviews.text: It performed as expected. Make sure yo unplug the cord or the led stays on I have about 10 of these and even though they are LED that cost of electricity adds up.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Na Val

customer_reviews.title: Can't build one for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cord is a little overkill for what I needed, but should work just fine. Use of fine stranded copper leads and whatever the coating is, allows cord to maintain excellent flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: MikeBoyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for EV chargers.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid build but pretty flexible. I am using as an extension for a Tesla UMC Gen 2 charger and I get full rated 32 amps of charge. connectors fit very snug.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo Cat

customer_reviews.title: Welder extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Why stretch your leads across the shop. Wish I woul have found these years ago. I use for my stick and mig 240 VAC welders.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Z

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Welder Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: This is much better than I expected for the price. Lighted ends to let you know there is power there. Cord worked as described. Jacket and plugs are excellent. Would purchase again and would recommend this product to all.
customer_reviews.author: James Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I don't like is the lighted respectable as it wastes power as ...
customer_reviews.text: This cord is heavy duty, well made, and at the same time flexible. Other cords I look at lacked the flexibility, which makes them difficult to coil, etc. An additional plus is the blue matches my Miller welder. Only thing I don't like is the lighted respectable as it wastes power as I leave the cord plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: rsw686

customer_reviews.title: Performed well with 240 volt welder
customer_reviews.text: Need the ability to reach out onto driveway to weld some projects. Expensive but very heavy construction and should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: csobol

customer_reviews.title: Beats DIY.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, sturdy. Lighted receptacle is helpful. Waited for a sale. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tickles

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Cover appears to be vinyl. I don't have great confidence in its durability, but it works fine and didn't cost a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Caballero

customer_reviews.title: This is so worth it.
customer_reviews.text: What a great extension cord for my welder! So well made and priced right.
customer_reviews.author: Hellenic

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty extension cord
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice big blue heavy duty extension cord for your welder. I am using it with my new Miller Matic 211 and have not had any problems. The lighted ends to show you have power are nice.
customer_reviews.author: GmDTX

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Very robust
customer_reviews.text: Extension cord. Works great. Very robust. Love the little power light led that tells me it's live. If it wasn't going to be used as an extension for a welding set, I'd be tying up a yacht with the damn thing. Great colour too.
customer_reviews.author: William Farran

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Extension
customer_reviews.text: If you need to be able to move your 240v welder away from the power source this very heavy duty extension is the way to go. I considered building one myself, but couldn't keep the price anywhere near this one. The connectors are very nice. I have used this quite a bit within the last couple of weeks of purchase and know it will hold up for some time. One thing of note is that the outer blue skin is prone to scratches from being dragged across the cement, but to me that is not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. James

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Great cable. I get zero drop over the length of the cable. Its about 1 inch thick.
customer_reviews.author: Vetteboy

customer_reviews.title: Very stout cord. Use it on a 240amp welder ...
customer_reviews.text: Very stout cord. Use it on a 240amp welder and a plasma with zero issues. Even been run over a couple times with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with quality and construction, works fantastic as an extension cord for my Miller welder
customer_reviews.author: Aleric

customer_reviews.title: Welder extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: This is a duplicate purchase of this cord, I needed more reach from the plug to welder. 1st cord has worked great, appears to be heavy duty, well made.
customer_reviews.author: Pedal Rider

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Molded plug, and receptacle, reasonably flexible cord, light to indicate power present.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Only wish I'd bought the 50' one, but it does work great, very durable and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Andy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my garage welder.
customer_reviews.text: This is the piece that goes between my dryer pigtail/ NEMA outlet that I built and my welder. Great quality. It should last a long time. Supple and heavy duty. A rare combination.
customer_reviews.author: arcorabin

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy cord
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy cord that does very well for my welder. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Red State

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made. Heavy duty. Good value. Has good flexibility for such heavy gauge.
customer_reviews.author: gndc

customer_reviews.title: Welder Cable
customer_reviews.text: Well made extension cord that I have used with my welder and a 220 volt heater.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice extension!
customer_reviews.text: Good product, seems durable and does what it's supposed to do! I'm using it on my Miller welder that's blue, so this cable sort of looks like it goes with the welder.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Liggett

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, well priced cord
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the UL listing, a bit stiff but was expected at this price point. Ends fit EXTREMELY well and snug, which I like. Lit female receptacle is also a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Brock E.

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: overall it seems like a solid plug super thick and heavy... my only draw back is plugging into it can be a hassle based on the plugs but other than that this thing is definitely nice
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K.

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you're going to be welding
customer_reviews.text: For the price and quality if you're an avid hobby welder you're gonna want to pick this up ASAP. Increases my range in my garage so now for really big repairs I can take it outside of need be.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great welder extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: Works well to get more extension for the welder. Able to move around move now. Good product and well made. No trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken P

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and Thick
customer_reviews.text: Appears to have a thick jacket on the conductors. Perfect for the amp draw of my welder.
customer_reviews.author: Tatarin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Hasn't given me any issues. Coils and stores pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmin Pasic

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Iv only used it a couple of times so far..so no real in depth review yet...but so far it seems real good quality and pretty durable. My only is i had was the make end was smaller than the outlet on my generator. I baught an adapter and it all plugged rite in and worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BPR-1

customer_reviews.title: New welding cord
customer_reviews.text: I bought your welding cord to go with my new stick welder. I arrived quickly and work great. Quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: great product look like it will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: JERRY MOELLER

customer_reviews.title: Great welding cord
customer_reviews.text: My husband was worried that this welder cord wouldn't work since it wasn't one of the more expensive cords available. He plugged it in and used the welder for about an hour and the cord was completely cool to the touch. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, i bought this to cut it in half and hook it up to my 220volt air compressor. It worked just as it should, the shielding on the wires and the main sheilding it very thick and rugged, i have no doubts tou could get many years of service with this cord dragging across a floor for a welder or whatever you need it for!
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Works great in home garage shop
customer_reviews.text: Very solid extension for my welder, I'm very happy with it in my home garage shop.
customer_reviews.author: ReyAce

customer_reviews.title: Beefy
customer_reviews.text: I had now idea how big this was gonna be. Everyone said to go with 8/3 for a welder. Glad I did. Price is great and it’s stout for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Wow, a serious cable for my welder and plasma cutter. Very pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Commodore

customer_reviews.title: Best extension cable for welding equipment.
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord is perfect for use with my MIG Welder and Plasma Cutter. I would normally just make my own extension cord; but, this cord with factory molded ends is much safer in my applications. I would definitely recommend for welding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only for temporary use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for shop and Tesla charging. Have to find time to run 1" conduit. I want to keep NEMA 6-50 as a standard in small shop. Got Plasma table, plasma cutters, welders, three other building all NEMA 6-50 outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Vern2

customer_reviews.title: the sign fabricater
customer_reviews.text: i work in a fab shop all my coworkers are impressed with the quality of this cord. fair price good quality
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Looks very professional
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Looks very professional. No more having to piece an extension cord together from a big box store. Absolutely pleased with this purchase. I use this on a millermatic 212 mig welder. With no problems!
customer_reviews.author: ryan symons

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for this extension cord for my air compressor and welder it is built absolutely great heavy duty the ends in the light and one mental health cc to move around to move around
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Solid extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy wire. Tested out fine with my welder. Should last a long time with proper care.
customer_reviews.author: Sagmiester

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just what I needed and no I could ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just what I needed and no I could not have made a better extension although I did make a 100 ft extension, 6 gauge, out of necessity (not as good).
customer_reviews.author: uncle bob

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great as an extension cord for my Lincoln welders. Heavy duty construction, quality plugs and power indicator light nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: JD Fan

customer_reviews.title: Not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a cheap exrension cord. Very heavy, very heavy duty!
customer_reviews.author: Don derouen

customer_reviews.title: Cable is too stiff
customer_reviews.text: The cable is decent quality. Only problem is it's so stiff that it never lays flat. Would have preferred something more flexible
customer_reviews.author: William Flood

customer_reviews.title: Not "Southwire" but really well made.
customer_reviews.text: I cut the female end off and wired it direct to my welder as my primary cord. There's plenty of copper, and the individual wires inside are heavily insulated. I'll buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Coils easily and cleans up well
customer_reviews.text: No problems running my 220v welder on this. Flexible. Coils easily and cleans up well. Seems well made. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worked with another 50ft cord and Harbor Freight Welder.
customer_reviews.text: Good tight connection, worked added to 20ft cord on 220 HF Welder.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: ROBUST, VERY WELL MADE
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't build my own much cheaper. I have used this four times in the last week, it is strong, prongs are solid, it grips my plugs well, and the sheathing is thick. It should last a LOOOOONG time.
customer_reviews.author: eric j weed

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Very nice heavy duty cable, worked great on my 45XP plasma cutter, no warm plugs connections. Would buy again. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Very usefull
customer_reviews.text: I neede this attatchment to reach the dryer outlet, with a 3 prong adapter, to charge my Nissan Leaf, GREAT
customer_reviews.author: John C. Vrooman Jr.

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty extension cord stands up well to use in a shop.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice welding extension cord!
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty welding cord! Great price and free shipping, what more can I ask for!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty cord. Nice
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and nice. Works great, looks great and is made well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Connors

customer_reviews.title: Good cord.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Lincoln tombstone welder. It was a little better quality than what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Guilmette

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Seems legit and made well. Heavy duty and looks like it will last. Used to extend my reach when wedding in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Young

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cord. Its super heavy. I sort of wish I got a longer one but its great
customer_reviews.author: CDR

customer_reviews.title: Nice cord
customer_reviews.text: i use it to power my miller mig welder, over kill, but who dont like over kill
customer_reviews.author: Duane B.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! what a tank! Looks high quality and ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! what a tank! Looks high quality and allows me to cart my 220 tools around without affecting their performance (i only have one 220 plug by the breaker box that is in an odd place) NOTE: is a lot thicker (0.8 in) and heavier that the way it looks in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: The Scopesmith LLC

customer_reviews.title: Great Cord
customer_reviews.text: I bought this extension cord for my welder. Works Great.
customer_reviews.author: malefic

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Well made. It will last many years. Price is good also
customer_reviews.author: Francis Bartolomeo

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is just what our grandson was looking for. Cost over $150 in the stores. Thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Curly23

customer_reviews.title: Excellent extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Delivered and performed as expected. Sturdy construction, should last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly impressed
customer_reviews.text: Was highly impressed when it arrived as I was fearful it would not be so great but to my delight it turns out to be very good quality
customer_reviews.author: Richard jaworski

customer_reviews.title: 220 extension cord
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Would buy again. Used on my Audi etron charger.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: A well made cord
customer_reviews.text: Got it today, pulled it out of the box, hooked it to our plasma cutter, and cut 1/8" plate for the next four hours. Cable worked perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zientek

customer_reviews.title: EVSE extension
customer_reviews.text: I got this extension cord as a means to relocate my EVSE unit as the original spot i selected was deemed unsatisfactory. Rather than shelling out for an electrician to relocate the receptacle and run conduit to the new location, I used this cord instead and secured it with conduit hole straps for substantially less.
customer_reviews.author: Cab00b

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WELDER EXTENTION CORD
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for the buck! Well made and rugged. This cord will do the job as described.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

product_meta.title: Southwire 19178806 8/3 Heavy-Duty STW 40-Amp/250-Volt Nema 6-50 Blue Welder Extension Cord, 25- Feet, 8-Gauge, STW jacket for Superior Performance, Rated at 40 Amps, 250 Volts and 10,000 Watts
product_meta.description: Coleman Cable 1917 8/3 STW 6-50 Welder Extension Cord, Blue, 25-Foot. 8-Gauge plug. Stw jacket for heavy-duty performance. Lighted receptacle end indicates when power is on. Molded ends offer safety and convenience on the jobsite. Bring portability to welding machines and create convenience. Provide a convenient, safe method to extend the range of welding equipment. Intended for new commercial construction, mro industrial and general welding. The Coleman Cable brand is a registered trademark of Coleman Cable Inc.
feature_bullets: 8-Gauge STW jacket for SUPERIOR PERFORMANCE and FLEXIBILITY
LIGHTED RECEPTACLE END indicates when power is on
MOLDED ENDS offer safety and convenience on the jobsite
Offers more PORTABILITY to welding machines
Extension Cord rated at 40 Amps, 250 Volts and 10,000 Watts
